intro: Lesquerella occidentalis subsp. diversifolia, commonly known as the western lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive seed pods that contain oily seeds used in industrial applications. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental value. This subspecies is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
